caption.p: Thymus vulgaris essential oil (TEO: 25, 150, and 300 μL/L) improved memory in the novel object recognition (NOR) test. ( A) Representative locomotion tracking pattern of the control, scopolamine (Sco: 100 μM), and TEO (25, 150, and 300 μL/L) treated groups; ( B) Represent the exploratory time in different groups; ( C) Represent the percentages of preference in different groups. Values are means ± S.E.M. ( n = 10). For Tukey’s post hoc analyses: ( B) # p < 0.01; ( C) Control vs. Sco (100 µM): ## p < 0.001, Sco vs. TEO (25 µL/L): # p < 0.01, Sco vs. TEO (150 µL/L): # p < 0.01, and Sco vs. TEO (300 µL/L): # p < 0.01.
